intro: Polylepis lanata, commonly known as the woolly polylepis, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, woolly foliage and rugged, shrub-like appearance. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Polylepis lanata has adapted to harsh climates with strong winds and low temperatures. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various endemic species and playing a role in soil stabilization.
